page.title: 09Ilkeston Dialect
page.content: Hello/ey up, canal/cut, nothing/nowt thirty/thotty, water/watter, learn/lon first/fost, third/thod, friend/sorry passage/jitty, other/tuther, Heanor/Ana, Thursday/Thosdi, home/om, work/wok, crying/scratin, whining/mytherin, worrying/wittlin, dirty/dotti, ears/tabs, miserable/mardi, slide/sluther, pavement/causey, policeman/bobby, to turn (a handle)/waller, word/wod, worse/woss, awry/skewift, scratch/piggle, curse/coss, curtains/ cottins, in the/int, don't be/dunna be going home/guin om, I have got a/ Iv gorra, Are you going home/ Artaguinom?, Have you got a nail?/ Astagorraneel?, Have you got her with you?/Ayagorraweeya? It looks like rain/Its black ower Bills mothers, Be quiet/shurrup, take care/yo'll inja ya, everything/bag o'mashins
